Indian Economy.title: The Indian economy’s 8.2% second-quarter growth: Can it expand at such a brisk pace for years to come?
Indian Economy.summary: Last quarter’s data has cheered India, but the challenge is to keep the economy growing at 8% plus for years to come. This year’s consumption stimulus may be working, but the investment rate must rise. For the private sector to do its bit, revive public-priva…

Indian Economy.title: Close call but RBI MPC could cut repo by 25 bps, economists say
Indian Economy.summary: The single digit nominal GDP growth continues to signal tepid underlying activity; despite the high real GDP growth, the bank retains its expectations of 25 bps repo cut on account of inflation trajectory being benign

Indian Economy.title: VA Nageswaran: In turbulent world, India stands out for turning economic adversity into an advantage
Indian Economy.summary: Steady, pragmatic and long-horizon policies have given India the ability to turn global volatility into economic possibility. We have sustained growth while others slowed, kept inflation in check, put the fisc on a consolidation path, drawn capital, accelerat…

Indian Economy.title: High growth rate brings difference in opinions on rate cut by Monetary Policy Committee
Indian Economy.summary: On November 28, the Statistics Ministry reported headline growth number at 8.2%, highest in six quarters; this is much higher than RBI’ projection of 7% and also various agencies’ expectation of 7.5-8%

Indian Economy.title: RBI may cut interest rate by 25 bps on Friday

Stock Market.title: RBI's interest rate decision, global trends, FIIs moves key drivers for markets: Analysts
Stock Market.summary: India's economy grew at a higher-than-expected 8.2 per cent - the fastest pace in six quarters - in July-September, as front-loading of production ahead of GST rates cut boosted consumption that helped offset the impact of steep US tariffs

Stock Market.title: FPIs in Nov; withdraw ₹3,765 cr from equities
Stock Market.summary: On the global front, uncertainty around the US Federal Reserve's rate-cut trajectory, a firm US dollar, and weak risk appetite across emerging markets kept foreign investors cautious

Stock Market.title: Mcap boost: 7 of top-10 firms gain ₹96,201 cr; Reliance, Bajaj Finance lead chart
Stock Market.summary: Among the top-10 firms, Reliance led, followed by HDFC Bank, Airtel, TCS, ICICI Bank, SBI, Infosys, Bajaj Finance, HUL and LIC.

Stock Market.title: Active mid-caps are struggling. Time to go passive?
Stock Market.summary: Actively managed mid-cap funds are struggling to beat their benchmark as the rules tighten and stock discovery shrinks. Should investors switch to low-cost passive strategies — or stay the active course?

Startups & Funding.title: Bigger cheques, fewer deals: What’s driving India’s startup revival?
Startups & Funding.summary: Deal value is on the mend as well, and that's despite lower volumes. While 2024 saw early-stage startups raise $1.5 billion across 513 deals, this year so far has seen 432 deals with companies raising a total of $1.6 billion.

Startups & Funding.title: OpenAI to Anthropic — Do multiple funding rounds for top AI startups pose risks amid AI bubble concerns?
Startups & Funding.summary: Companies like OpenAI and Anthropic are raising multiple rounds in funding while boosting their valuations — Here's what experts say about back-to-back funding rounds posing as a risk for the companies amid the AI bubble fears in the industry.

Banking & Finance.title: Bank holidays next week: When are banks closed from 1-7 December? Check here
Banking & Finance.summary: Bank holidays next week: From December 1 to December 7, banks in certain Indian states will observe two holidays, specifically on December 1 for State Inauguration Day and December 3 for the Feast of St. Francis Xavier, with all banks closed on Sundays.

Banking & Finance.summary: Over 10 lakh beneficiaries in J&K received ₹43,000 crore in credit during H1 FY26, boosting economic growth and self-employment.

Technology Sector.summary: A video shared on the Army’s official Instagram page shows the soldiers playing cricket in a snow-laden region using an improvised setup.

Technology Sector.title: Rajasthan minister asks schools to celebrate Babri Masjid demolition day as ‘Shaurya Diwas’, later withdraws order citing exams
Technology Sector.summary: In the now withdrawn order, Rajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar asked schools to organise educational and cultural activities to promote patriotism and national unity on December 6, the anniversary of the Babri Masjid demolition.
